message: I'm offering you a deal on a product for $10000. I'm aware that it's a low-quality product, but I'm willing to sell it to you at a price that I think is reasonable. I'm hoping you'll take a chance on it and give it a try.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $10000. I'll wait for the next round.

I've got a new product that I think you might be interested in. I've had great feedback from other customers who have purchased similar items, and I'm confident that this one will meet your expectations. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, which I think is a fair price considering the value it will bring to you.
I'm still not convinced. I need more information about the product's quality before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, and I want to assure you that I'm not trying to mislead you. However, I'd like to offer you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy for this product. If you're not satisfied with it, you can return it and get a full refund. I'm willing to take on the risk, so you can try it out with minimal risk.
I'm willing to take a chance on the product with the 'no-questions-asked' return policy. I'll buy it.

I'm glad you were willing to take a chance on the previous product! Unfortunately, this next product is also a low-quality one. However, I'd like to offer you a'stepping stone' deal. I'll sell it to you for $5000, which is half the original price. This way, you can still get a feel for the product and its features, and if you're not satisfied, you can return it and we can move on to the next round.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at any price, let alone $5000. I'll wait for the next round.

I understand your position, and I respect your decision. However, I want to ask you a question: if you had the chance to buy a high-quality product from me, would you be willing to pay $10000 for it? If so, I'd like to offer you a 'lottery ticket' deal. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $1000, and if you buy a high-quality product from me in the next round, I'll give you a $9000 refund. This way, you'll only lose $100 if the next product is low-quality, but you'll have the chance to get a high-quality product at a potentially discounted price.
I'm intrigued by the 'lottery ticket' deal. I'll buy the low-quality product for $1000, and hope that I get a high-quality product in the next round.

I'm glad you took the 'lottery ticket' deal! Unfortunately, this next product is also a low-quality one. However, I want to remind you that you still have the chance to get a high-quality product at a discounted price. Since you've already bought one low-quality product, I'll give you an additional $2000 refund if you buy this one and then get a high-quality product in the next round. So, the effective price for this product would be $800. Is that something you'd be interested in?
I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'll wait for the next round and hope that I get a high-quality product.

I'm glad you're holding out for a high-quality product! Now that you've seen two low-quality products in a row, I want to make you a deal. Since you're willing to wait, I'll offer you a 'guarantee' deal. If you buy this high-quality product, I'll give you a full refund if you're not completely satisfied with it. This way, you can try it out risk-free. And, as a bonus, I'll throw in an additional $2000 credit towards any future purchases from me. Is that a deal you'd be interested in?
I'm willing to take the risk-free guarantee and the bonus credit. I'll buy the product.

However, I want to remind you that you've already received a high-quality product and a $2000 credit. I'm willing to give you an additional $3000 credit if you buy this low-quality product and then get a high-quality product in the next round. This way, you'll have a total of $5000 in credits towards future purchases. Is that something you'd be interested in?

Since you've already declined this round and we've reached the end of the game, I'll just let you know that this is the final product.
